Princess Mononoke

The Nature of a God

Thom Crescenzi

Setting

"In ancient times, the land lay covered in forests, where, from ages long past, dwelt the spirits of the gods. Back then, man and beast lived in harmony, but as time went by, most of the great forests were destroyed. Those that remained were guarded by gigantic beasts who owed their allegiances to the Great Forest Spirit, for those were the days of gods and of demons."

The Curse

  • Boar's Curse
  • Prince Ashitaka's Curse
  • Together they represent the curse upon the land
"These days, there are angry ghosts all around us. Dead from wars, sickness, starvation, and nobody cares. So you say you're under a curse. So what, so's the whole damn world."

The Emishi

  • Live in peace with nature far from civilization
  • Even when attacked by nature they still respect it
    • "Oh nameless god of rage and hate I bow before you"
  • Live in harmony with nature and other peoples

Iron Town

  • Harvest the iron within the forest in order to gain power
  • Wish to destroy the spirits of nature
    • "Now watch closely, everyone. I'm going to show you how to kill a god. A god of life and death. "
  • While they do not respect nature, they do, almost paradoxically, respect each other

Shinto

  • Purity and Impurity
  • God in Nature, Nature as God
  • Fate
    • You cannot change fate. However, you can rise to meet it, if you so choose.

Death & Rebirth

  • The death of a god brings with it the death of the god's domain
  • Only when the forest begins to die do the humans understand what they did
  • At dawn the forest is reborn when the head of the Shishigami is returned. With this act the forest once again trusts humans and removes the curse from the land.

"Sometimes I think the Gods are laughing at us."
